description: Test your knowledge of Windchill life cycles, workflows, and business process automation

questions.text: What is a life cycle in Windchill?
options: A workflow template for approval processes
An automated graphical model that employs phases and gates to manage objects from conceptualization to obsolescence
A team template for role assignment

questions.text: What is the primary difference between life cycle states and versioning?
options: Versioning defines maturity, life cycle states reflect history
Life cycle states are numerical, versioning is alphabetical
Life cycle states define maturity, while versioning reflects an object's history

questions.text: What are the two distinct areas that comprise a life cycle state?
How many template types define Windchill's business process definition?
What do Team templates and Context teams work together to accomplish?
options: Map participants to generic roles used in life cycles and workflows

questions.text: What type of transitions do Basic life cycles use?
Which life cycle type is recommended for most Windchill objects?
What do Advanced life cycles use for life cycle movement?
Where can you access the Life Cycle Template Administration utility?
options: From the Utilities page in site, organization, product, or library contexts

questions.text: To apply a life cycle throughout the entire system, where should you create it?
What is a transition in a life cycle?
options: A named path from a source state to a destination state

questions.text: For Basic life cycles, what is the only means of life cycle movement?
How many states does the PTC Publications Basic life cycle have?
What object class is recommended to set when creating a life cycle?
In Windchill versions before 12.1, where must new state names be added?
In Windchill 12.1 and later, where can you add new state names?
options: In the Type and Attribute Management utility in the Customize Modeled Enumerations list

questions.text: Which transition type defines the path used when promoting or demoting the state of objects?
Which transition type defines the path used when creating a new version of an object?
What transition type is only valid for promotion requests and used as an interim state?
What determines the life cycle template used to manage an object's development?
What happens if the system cannot locate a life cycle template by the name in the object initialization rules?
options: It prompts the user to select a life cycle
It uses the default life cycle
It removes the ability to create the object in the specified context
It creates a new life cycle automatically

questions.text: What is state-based versioning?
options: Using different versioning schemes depending on the object life cycle state

questions.text: What are the two choices for state-based version series?
When using state-based versioning, what determines the initial versioning scheme?
options: The version series in the object initialization rules
The version series identified for the first state

questions.text: In Advanced life cycles, what do roles enable you to do?
options: Reuse life cycles and workflow templates across many product lines or libraries

questions.text: What is the most flexible, common, and recommended method of conducting role resolution?
What type of access control is life cycle access control?
What permissions are all roles automatically given in life cycle access control?
What can override life cycle access control rules?
options: Absolute deny rules from the domain or security labels

questions.text: For each state in an Advanced life cycle, where can you assign workflow templates?
options: Phase only, gate only, both phase and gate, or no workflows
Only in both phase and gate together

questions.text: When creating a new advanced life cycle state, what workflows are added by default?
options: Submit workflow for phase and Review workflow for gate
Review workflow for both phase and gate

questions.text: What should you always do after adding a new advanced life cycle state to avoid unattended process startup?
What is a best practice regarding the number of states in a life cycle?
options: Use a minimum of states to simplify access rights and transitions
Use as many states as possible
Use different numbers for each object type

questions.text: What should you do with out-of-the-box life cycles before customizing them?
options: Do not modify them; keep them as a reference and create new ones with a save-as action

questions.text: What prevents an object from modification in life cycle gates?
What are workflow templates used to establish?
options: The specific events and tasks that occur in each life cycle state

questions.text: What are the types of nodes used in workflows?
options: Activity, Process, Connector, Robot, and Terminal
Start, Stop, Pause, Resume, and End

questions.text: What does an Activity node define in a workflow?
What does a Connector node define in a workflow?
What does a Robot node do in a workflow?
What does a Terminal node do in a workflow?
In the Modular workflow approach, what is the main benefit?
In the Single workflow approach, where is the complete workflow mapped?
options: In the phase of the first state

questions.text: What is an advantage of the Single workflow approach?
What is a disadvantage of the Single workflow approach?
What approach should be used when all state move procedures are not formalized?
What is an advantage of the Change and Promotion Request approach?
options: No need to associate a workflow template to a business object

questions.text: How do you create a new workflow template?
options: Open the Workflow Template Administration utility and click the New template icon

questions.text: What is the Responsible Role in workflow template properties?
options: The backup role used during role resolution issues and recipient of deadline or error notifications
The role that approves all tasks

questions.text: How many tabs are in the workflow template properties?
What does an assigned activity node represent?
options: A step where a user or group must perform a task or make a business decision

questions.text: Where do users receive assigned activities?
What is special about an Ad Hoc activity?
options: It has a special screen so the recipient can create and assign additional activities to other users at runtime

questions.text: How many tabs are in the activity Properties?
What does the Start connector represent?
options: The starting point in a process

questions.text: How many Start connectors can each process have?
When does the And connector allow the process to continue?
options: When any incoming link is fired
When every incoming link is fired

questions.text: When does the Or connector allow the process to continue?
options: When any incoming link is fired
When all incoming links are fired

questions.text: What happens to incomplete activities when an Or connector fires?
options: They are terminated and removed from the assignee's task list

questions.text: What does the Conditional router use to determine which path to follow?
options: Custom criteria specified in Java code

questions.text: What does the Threshold connector do?
options: Allows the process to continue after a set number of incoming links have been fired

questions.text: What is the difference between terminal nodes and connectors?
options: Terminals do not have outgoing links

questions.text: What does the Ground terminal do?
options: Does not have outgoing links but permits active nodes in parallel branches to continue

questions.text: What does the End terminal do?
options: Stops the process entirely, ending all processing and active activities

questions.text: Must all workflows eventually lead to an End terminal?
options: Yes, or the process will not stop without administrative intervention
Only if using advanced life cycles
No, they can end with Ground terminals
No, they can end with any terminal

questions.text: What do links define in workflows?
options: The flow control among nodes and which actions are performed

questions.text: What are the two most common actions selected in link properties?
What is the most common event in link properties?
What is a loop link used for?
options: To reenable nodes in a loop so they may be executed again

questions.text: What are Block processes used for?
options: To simplify complex workflows by grouping related activities into smaller process blocks

questions.text: Can Block processes be referenced by other workflow templates?
options: No, only by the parent workflow template
Yes, but only with special permissions
Yes, but only in the same organization

questions.text: What are Proxy processes used for?
options: To simplify complex workflows by referencing other standalone workflow templates stored in Windchill

questions.text: Can Proxy processes be referenced by multiple parent workflow templates?
options: Yes, several parent workflow templates can reference these workflow processes

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of using robots in workflows?
options: To enforce consistency and improve process efficiency by automating common process tasks

questions.text: What are the four basic robot types?
What knowledge is required to use advanced robots effectively?
options: Java, Info*Engine, and the Windchill API

questions.text: What are Windchill background queues used for?
options: For processing many tasks like email notifications, life cycles, and workflows

questions.text: When are background queues created?
What file controls the configuration of all background queues?
What is tuning in the context of Windchill workflows?
options: Adjusting the server to improve response time and maximize throughput in the background

questions.text: Where can you access the Queue Management utility?
What are the three primary Windchill queues used for processing workflow tasks?
What does the WfPropagationQueue handle?
options: Connectors, assigned activities, and links state changes

questions.text: What does the WfUserWorkQueue handle?
options: Instantiating workflow robots and executing workflow robot actions

questions.text: What does the WfScheduleQueue handle?
options: All timed events including deadline checks

questions.text: What do failed entries in workflow queues indicate?
What is the default type for all workflow queues?
How do pool queues process entries?
What is the default value for wt.queue.execEntriesCount property?
What happens to daemon threads when there are no more entries to process?
options: They become idle and are removed after a set idle time

questions.text: What is the default idle time before daemon threads are removed?
What is queue pooling?
options: A pool of multiple WfUserWorkQueue and WfPropagationQueue queues

questions.text: What property controls the number of UserWork queues in queue pooling?
What are dedicated queues?
options: Queues tied to specific workflow templates

questions.text: What must you do first to enable dedicated queue processing?
options: Set the wt.workflow.engine.dedicatedQueueMode property in wt.properties

questions.text: What is the default value for wt.workflow.engine.dedicatedQueueMode?
What does the 'All' value mean for wt.workflow.engine.dedicatedQueueMode?
options: Dedicated WfUserWorkQueue and WfPropagationQueue for workflow templates with dedicated queue flag enabled

questions.text: What property determines if newly created workflow templates have dedicated queues by default?
What does wt.workflow.engine.dedicatedQueuePerProcess property do when set to true?
options: Creates one queue for all processes
Creates a new queue for every instance of a process initiated from a template with Has Dedicated Queue flag
